content.body: No it's not; you need to write `arr.map(obj::obj.method)`
content.formatted_body: No it's not; you need to write arr.map(obj::obj.method)

content.body: If you've *already* extracted the method into a variable, you can write the simpler way, but that's not the case I usually run into.
content.formatted_body: If you've already extracted the method into a variable, you can write the simpler way, but that's not the case I usually run into.

content.body: oh, right, that only works if `method` is extracted. maybe i was thinking of the original bind operator proposal where it'd be `::obj.method`
content.formatted_body: oh, right, that only works if method is extracted. maybe i was thinking of the original bind operator proposal where it'd be ::obj.method
